Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

Question.name: Q_938263
Question.title: Histologic Type and Grade# (Notes D, E)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59691
DisplayedItem.title: # For poorly differentiated (high-grade) neuroendocrine carcinomas arising in the small intestine or ampulla, the checklists for carcinomas of those organ sites should be used.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_48579
DisplayedItem.title: Mitotic rate and / or Ki-67 labeling index is required to determine histologic grade

Question.name: Q_379339
Question.title: ?Mitotic Rate (required only when Ki-67 labeling index is not reported)#

DisplayedItem.name: DI_38503
DisplayedItem.title: # Mitotic rate should be reported as number of mitoses per 2 mm2, by evaluating at least 10 mm2 in the most mitotically active part of the tumor (e.g., if using a microscope with a field diameter of 0.55 mm, count 42 high power fields (10 mm2) and divide the resulting number of mitoses by 5 to determine the number of mitoses per 2 mm2 needed to assign tumor grade).

ListItem.name: LI_379336
ListItem.title: Specify number of mitoses per 2 mm2

Question.name: Q_379340
Question.title: ?Ki-67 Labeling Index (required only when mitotic rate is not reported)

ListItem.name: LI_51739
ListItem.title: Composite ganliocytoma / neuroma and neuroendocrine tumor (previously known as Gangliocytic paraganglioma)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37444
DisplayedItem.title: Specify size of largest tumor if multiple tumors are present

ListItem.name: LI_49927
ListItem.title: Invades through sphincter into duodenal submucosa

ListItem.name: LI_54839
ListItem.title: Invades through sphincter into duodenal muscularis propria

Question.name: Q_366207
Question.title: Distance from Tumor to Closest Margin

ListItem.name: LI_39502
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_358355
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_358360
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.name: Q_50265
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937042
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_937042_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937057
DisplayedItem.title: # Multiple tumors should be designated as such (the largest tumor should be used to assign T category). Use T(#); e.g., pT3(4) N0 M0, OR use the m suffix, T(m); e.g., pT3(m) N0 M0.

ListItem.name: LI_937051
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_937038
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor invades the mucosa or submucosa only, and is less than or equal to 1 cm in greatest dimension (duodenal tumors); tumor is less than or equal to 1 cm in greatest dimension and confined within the sphincter of Oddi (ampullary tumors)

ListItem.name: LI_937039
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria or is greater than 1 cm in greatest dimension (duodenal tumors); tumor invades through sphincter into duodenal submucosa or muscularis propria, or is greater than 1 cm in greatest dimension (ampullary tumors)

ListItem.name: LI_937040
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor invades the pancreas or peripancreatic adipose tissue

ListItem.name: LI_937041
ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor invades the visceral peritoneum (serosa) or other organs

ListItem.name: LI_937060
ListItem.title: (m) multiple primary synchronous tumors in a single organ

ListItem.name: LI_937053
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_937054
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_937048
ListItem.title: pN0: No tumor involvement of regional lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_937049
ListItem.title: pN1:Tumor involvement of regional lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_937047
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_937047_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937046
DisplayedItem.title: pM1: Microscopic confirmation of distant metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_937045
ListItem.title: pM1a: Microscopic confirmation of metastasis confined to liver

ListItem.name: LI_937044
ListItem.title: pM1b: Microscopic confirmation of metastasis in at least one extrahepatic site (e.g., lung, ovary, nonregional lymph node, peritoneum, bone)

ListItem.name: LI_937043
ListItem.title: pM1c: Microscopic confirmation of both hepatic and extrahepatic metastases
